intro: Hippochaete hyemalis f. hondae, commonly known as the Honduran winter heather, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires partial shade to full sun. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
